lead_paragraph: The order from the Kremlin came as the United Nations was trying to revive peace talks to stop the conflict, which has created a humanitarian catastrophe.

byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from Moscow, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by Andrew Higgins and Ivan Nechepurenko from Moscow, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, Gardiner Harris from Washington, and Somini Sengupta and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and ANNE BARNARD

headline.print_headline: Putin Orders Syria Pullout, Citing Success
headline.main: Putin Orders Start of Syria Withdrawal, Saying Goals Are Achieved

snippet: The order from the Kremlin came as the United Nations was trying to revive peace talks to stop the conflict, which has created a humanitarian catastrophe.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin orders Russian forces to withdraw from Syria, declaring Kremlin has achieved its objectives in war-torn country; move leaves people on all sides of conflict stunned and comes at critical moment, as United Nations pushes to revive peace process.
